page.title: 13LULLINGSTONE
page.content: The house I like best in the village is callled Lullingstone.It is an old thatched cotttage that has been modernised.It is a quarter of the way up Fore St.The village has a Church.Parts of it were built in the 13th century.The vilage also has a Jubilee Hall,and a pub.It used to have 3 pubs but 2 closed down.There a some old cottages along Western Way.Most of the houses in Church St are old.Next to the Church is the Vicarage.Now a familiy live there,instead of the vicar.The people who live there are making it modern.There are new houses in the village,mostly in Davies Close.They are council houses.There are some new bungalows in Court St.The village is a mixture of old and new houses. {BY MATTHEW TETT {
